excerpt: Temples built into 5 caves under overhanging rock, containing paintings, statues & wall murals.
detail_description: The Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple is a renowned attraction in Sri Lanka, featuring five caves carved into an overhanging rock. Dating back to the 1st century BC, this temple complex was established by King Valagam Bahu and houses 157 Buddha statues of various sizes, including a remarkable 15-meter long reclining Buddha. The caves also boast expansive murals and frescos, considered to be some of the largest antique painted surfaces globally.
name: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple
address: Kandy - Jaffna Hwy, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

excerpt: The ruins of a 5th-century city, anchored by a towering rock fortress accessible by steep stairs.
detail_description: Sigiriya is a 5th-century city with a towering rock fortress accessible by steep stairs. The rock's western face features the Sigiriya murals, also known as the Heavenly Maidens or Apsaras, which are vibrant frescoes depicting graceful women adorned with jewelry and garments. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is considered the 8th wonder of the world and sits atop a 180-meter-high rock between Dambulla and Habarana.
name: Sigiriya

excerpt: Dambulla is a city situated in the north of Matale District, in Sri Lanka's Central Province. It is the second largest populated and urbanised centre after Matale in the Matale District. It is situated 148 km north-east of Colombo, 43 km north of Matale and 72 km north of Kandy. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Dambulla, nestled in Sri Lanka's Central Province, is a vibrant city located 148 km northeast of Colombo and serves as the second largest urban center in the Matale District. Renowned for its rich cultural heritage, Dambulla boasts UNESCO World Heritage Sites that attract countless visitors each year. The city's highlights include the stunning Golden Temple and ancient Buddhist cave temples that reflect its spiritual significance.
name: Dambulla

excerpt: Destination for moderate hikes & climbs to the top of the rock, popular for panoramic views.
detail_description: If you're looking for a moderate hike and climb with breathtaking panoramic views, Pidurangala Rock is the place to be. Adjacent to the famous Sigiriya Rock, it offers an equally stunning view of its more renowned neighbor from a slightly lower height. With fewer crowds and a historic cave complex of its own, Pidurangala provides an epic 360-degree view of the surrounding valleys and is gaining popularity as a prime spot for catching the sunrise over Sigiriya Rock.
name: Pidurangala Rock

excerpt: This sprawling preserve features a large 3rd-century reservoir, plus elephants & other wildlife.
detail_description: Minneriya National Park, located in Sri Lanka's North Central Province, is a captivating destination for wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. Established as a national park in 1997, this expansive area was initially designated as a wildlife sanctuary back in 1938 to safeguard the Minneriya tank and its surrounding ecosystem.
name: Minneriya National Park

detail_description: Sigiriya, also known as Lions Rock, is a colossal rock fortress and palace located in the Matale District of Sri Lanka. Rising 200m from the forested plains, it boasts water gardens, boulder gardens, and terrace gardens. This ancient citadel showcases the artistic and architectural prowess of the Sinhalese civilization with its frescoes, mirror wall, and mesmerizing vistas.
name: Sigiriya

detail_description: Located in Dambulla, Sri Lanka, the Rangiri Dambulla International Cricket Stadium is a 30,000-seat stadium built in just 167 days. It was strategically constructed in the dry zone of the country to ensure matches can be organized throughout the year due to less rainfall compared to other areas. The stadium offers picturesque views overlooking the Dambulla Tank and Rock.
name: Rangiri Dambulla International Cricket Stadium

detail_description: Nestled along the Dambulla-Kandalama Road, Sam Popham's Arboretum stands as a unique gem in Sri Lanka, being the country's sole dry zone arboretum. This enchanting sanctuary spans over seven and a half acres of scrub jungle, showcasing an impressive variety of trees alongside vibrant birds, butterflies, dragonflies, and mammals thriving in their natural habitat.
name: Popham's Arboretum

detail_description: Dambulla Cave Temple, situated in the heart of Dambulla, is an ancient Buddhist temple that stands out as a remarkable cultural and religious attraction. Located 68 km from Kandy and just 2 km from the entrance to the Rock Temple, it offers visitors a glimpse into Sri Lanka's rich heritage. The temple features stunning fresco paintings predominantly depicting Buddha, making it one of the best archaeological sites to explore.
name: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple
address: VJ4W+8PV, Unnamed Road, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nestled just 25 minutes from Dambulla, Jathika Namal Uyana is a captivating destination that boasts the largest ironwood forest and one of the biggest pink quartz mountain ranges in Southeast Asia. This serene haven is steeped in history, with roots tracing back over 550 million years. Once a sanctuary for Buddhist monks during the reign of King Devanampiyatissa in the 8th century AD, it later served as a unique prison camp where inmates cultivated trees.
name: Jathika Namal Uyana
address: Madatugama - Pubbogama - Andiyagala Rd, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Large reservoir lake with areas for swimming & a variety of hotels providing mountain views.
detail_description: Kandalama Reservoir is a large lake surrounded by hotels offering stunning mountain views. It serves as a crucial water source for the region's agriculture and supports diverse bird species, making it perfect for birdwatching. Visitors can take boat tours to explore the reservoir and its surroundings. The area also features modern architectural hotels with luxurious amenities, spa facilities, and unique dining experiences. Nearby attractions include Nalanda Gedige, Kaludiya Pokuna, and the Yapahuwa Ancient Kingdom.
name: Kandalama Reservoir

detail_description: When in Dambulla, a visit to the Dambulla Dedicated Economic Center is a must for those interested in experiencing the bustling wholesale trade of fruits and vegetables. The center comes alive in the evening as workers and traders engage in processing activities amidst a lively atmosphere filled with fruit and vegetable palettes, lorries, and busy workers.
name: Dambulla Dedicated Economic Center
address: Kandy - Jaffna Hwy, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Habarana is a small city in the Anuradhapura District of Sri Lanka. The location has some mid-range and up hotels aimed at package tourists, and is a departure point for other nearby locations of greater interest. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Habarana, a small city in the Anuradhapura District of Sri Lanka, is a popular departure point for nearby attractions. The area offers mid-range and upscale hotels catering to package tourists. It serves as a convenient base for exploring destinations like Colombo, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, and Negombo.
name: Habarana

detail_description: Nestled just 5 kilometers from Dambulla, the Ibbankatuwa Megalithic Tombs offer a fascinating glimpse into Sri Lanka's ancient past. This archaeological site, dating back to between 700 and 400 BC, showcases well-preserved burial mounds that reflect the customs of pre-historic societies. The inhabitants of this era were skilled potters who practiced unique heating techniques and buried their deceased along with cherished possessions in clay pots.
name: Ibbankatuwa Megalithic Tombs

detail_description: Kaludiya Pokuna Archaeological Site, located in Dambulla, is an ancient forest area named after a dark pond. The site is rich in diverse flora and fauna, including both common and endangered species. It features ancient ruins such as a stupa known as the 'forgotten temple'. Visitors can enjoy exploring the beautiful surroundings with favorable weather conditions and may even spot elephants along the entrance road.
name: Kaludiya Pokuna Archaeological Site

detail_description: Nestled within the stunning Dambulla Cave Temple complex, the Buddhist Museum stands as a unique testament to the rich tapestry of Buddhism's history and culture, not just in Sri Lanka but across Asia. As the first museum dedicated solely to this spiritual tradition, it boasts an impressive collection of over 2,000 artifacts that include exquisite paintings, intricate sculptures, and significant relics. Each piece tells a story about Buddhism's evolution through various regions and eras.
name: Buddhist Museum
address: 679 Dambulla - Bakamuna - Kalugahawela Road, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Namal Uyana, located in the Galkiriagama area of Anuradhapura district, is a must-visit destination for tourists. The Ironwood forest is South Asia's largest rose quartz mountain range and offers a unique hiking experience through dense forests. The 1.5 km jungle path leads to the pink quartz mountain ranges, providing an adventurous trek. This protected area holds historical significance and boasts rich biodiversity and unique geography.
name: ජාතික නාමල්උයන | Namal Uyana
address: Madatugama - Pubbogama - Andiyagala Rd, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Dambulla Museum is a must-visit for art enthusiasts, especially those who appreciate wall paintings. The museum boasts stunning artwork that will captivate any visitor with its beauty and historical significance.
name: Dambulla museum

excerpt: Kandalama is a village in the Central Province of Sri Lanka. Kandalama is situated close to two UNESCO World Heritage Sites - the Dambulla cave temple and the Sigiriya rock fortress. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kandalama, a charming village nestled in the Central Province of Sri Lanka, is renowned for its proximity to two UNESCO World Heritage sites. The first is the ancient Dambulla cave temple dating back to the 1st century BC, while the second is the impressive Sigiriya rock fortress from the 5th century AD. These historical landmarks make Kandalama an ideal destination for travelers seeking to immerse themselves in Sri Lanka's rich cultural heritage.
name: Kandalama
Dambulla Main Bus Station
address: Kandy - Jaffna Hwy, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Dambulla Produce Market in Sri Lanka is a must-visit for those who want to experience the local culture and witness the bustling trade of fresh fruits and vegetables. The market offers a glimpse into the daily customs and traditions of the locals as they haggle for the best prices. Visitors can also enjoy tasting sweet bananas while exploring the vast range of produce grown in Sri Lanka. Additionally, it's conveniently located near the bus stand, making it easily accessible for travelers.
name: Market

excerpt: Ancient Buddhist temple built on a huge rock, a popular hike for history & panoramic views.
detail_description: Located just a couple of kilometers north of Sigiriya, the Pidurangala Royal Cave Temple is an ancient Buddhist temple situated on a massive rock outcrop. It is said to have been established when monks from Sigiriya were relocated to make way for the king's palace. The climb to the top offers panoramic views of the surrounding dense Sri Lankan forest and provides a stunning vantage point to see the entire Sigiriya complex.
name: Pidurangala Royal Cave Temple

detail_description: Sigiriya Airport is a convenient gateway for tourists visiting the Sigiriya Rock Fortress in the Central Province of Sri Lanka. This ancient marvel, recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site, was built by King Kashyapa and features his palace atop a nearly 100-meter high rock. The fortress boasts attractions such as the Lion Gate, vibrant frescoes, landscaped gardens, water gardens, and caves. Additionally, active fountains can be observed during the rainy season.
name: Sigiriya Airport

detail_description: Sigiriya Lion Rock, also known as Sigiriya ancient rock fortress, is a must-visit UNESCO World Heritage site in Sri Lanka. It stands at an impressive 200 meters high and features a challenging climb to the top, taking about half a day to explore. The fortress offers stunning views and is located just a 30-minute drive from Dambulla. Despite the 1200 steps to reach the summit, visitors are rewarded with breathtaking scenery that makes it all worthwhile.
name: Sigiriya Lion Rock

detail_description: The Sigiriya Frescoes, dating back to 480 AD, are a renowned attraction in Sri Lanka. Photography is prohibited in certain areas along the hike to protect these centuries-old rock paintings. Visitors must climb a unique staircase to view the ancient artwork, which includes stunning depictions of Apsaras. This site is often referred to as an ancient art gallery and is definitely worth a visit for those interested in history and culture.
name: Sigiriya Frescoes (480 AD)
Dambulla Cave Temple Bodhi Tree
address: VJ4X+HCJ, Dambulla Rock, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Ibbankatuwa is an ancient archaeological site located in central Sri Lanka. It is known for its mysterious underground tunnels and caves, which are believed to have been used as a place of refuge during ancient times. The site also features remnants of a complex irrigation system, indicating advanced engineering skills of the ancient inhabitants. Visitors can explore the network of tunnels and marvel at the ingenuity of the people who built them.
name: Ibbankatuwa

detail_description: Sunrise Dambulla offers an incredible sunrise view just 1km from the city. The colorful sunrise over the lagoon is a sight to behold, and visitors can also enjoy a thrilling hot air balloon ride for around 9000 rupees. This hour-long experience provides a unique perspective of the area's natural beauty.
name: Sunrise Dambulla
address: VJCJ+G2Q, Ibbankatuwa Tank Rd, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

name: Dambulu Uyanwatta Raja Maha Viharaya
address: VM42+9V2, Kandy Rd, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: MPS Swimming Pool is a popular recreational facility located in a serene environment. The pool offers a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, providing visitors with a relaxing atmosphere to unwind and enjoy the water. With its well-maintained facilities and clean surroundings, MPS Swimming Pool is an ideal spot for both individuals and families to have a great time.
name: MPS Swimming Pool

detail_description: Tourlk offers a variety of day trips and tours in Sri Lanka, including a day trip from Colombo to Dambulla. For $60 USD per person, visitors can explore Sigiriya Rock and the Dambulla Cave temple in just one day. The company is known for providing exceptional drivers who not only serve as guides but also become friends during the journey.
name: Tourlk

detail_description: If you're looking for an unforgettable adventure, the "Sri Lanka Tour Package | Sri Lanka Tour by Hidden Sri Lanka" is a fantastic choice. Travelers have shared their wonderful experiences, highlighting the safe and comfortable drives throughout the journey. The service provided has been described as excellent, with many recommending it highly for anyone seeking to explore this beautiful island nation. With such positive feedback, it's clear that this tour package offers both support and satisfaction for all who embark on it!
name: Sri Lanka Tour Package | Sri Lanka Tour by Hidden Sri Lanka

detail_description: If you're looking for an unforgettable way to explore Sri Lanka, look no further than Dambulla Tuk Tuk & Taxi Service. This service offers a unique opportunity to rent your own tuk-tuk and navigate the stunning landscapes of Sri Lanka at your own pace. With just a 2.5-hour drive from Colombo to Dambulla, you can easily embark on an adventure filled with breathtaking sights. Krishan, the driving force behind this service, truly understands what exceptional customer service means.
name: Dambulla Tuk Tuk & Taxi service

detail_description: Nestled along the picturesque Ibbankatuwa Lake Road, a journey to Namal Uyana is made even more delightful with the stunning views of Ibbankatuwa Lake. This scenic route offers travelers a chance to soak in the natural beauty surrounding them, making it an ideal stop before reaching the enchanting Namal Uyana. The experience is truly rewarding and adds an extra layer of charm to your visit!
name: Namal uyana
address: WH8C+855, Namal uyana, Dambulla, Sri Lanka

detail_description: The Menikdena Archeological Reserve and Arboretum is a well-maintained historical site located in Dambulla, accessible by bus. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the botanical gardens while exploring the ruins of this off-the-beaten-path landmark. The caretaker provides a brief overview of the area's history, making it an excellent destination for those interested in discovering fascinating archaeological sites with significant cultural significance. Despite its importance, it remains relatively unknown to many people.
name: Menikdena Archeological Reserve and Arboretum | මැණික්දෙන පුරාවිද්‍යා රක්ෂිතය සහ වෘක්ෂෝද්‍යානය

detail_description: The Ederagala Wana Senasuna, a serene and marvelous Buddhist Cave Temple, offers a remarkable experience away from the typical tourist spots. Located just outside Dambulla on the A6 highway, this small temple is adorned with exquisite decorations and artwork, featuring a magnificent statue of Lord Buddha. Notably, visitors can ascend a staircase to reach the summit's Stupa where breathtaking vistas of the surrounding countryside await on clear days, including the iconic Sigiriya Lion Rock.
name: Ederagala Wana Senasuna
